info.title: TDEI Gateway API
info.description: This is an API for interacting with the Transportation Data Equity Initiative (TDEI) data system. It is intended for applications producing data to and consuming data from the TDEI system. It currently supports GTFS-Pathways, GTFS-Flex v2 and OpenSidewalks v0.2 data schemas.

post.summary: Authenticates the user with the TDEI system.
post.description: Authenticates the user with the TDEI system. Returns an access token, if successfully authenticated.

200.description: Authentication successful - Returns the access token for the user.

400.description: Password does not satisfiy with password policy.

401.description: Authentication failed - Check username and password.

404.description: User not found.

post.summary: Re-issue an access token
post.description: Re-issues an access token, if a valid refresh token is sent to the server

schema.description: The refresh token that was sent through authentication or refresh token API

200.description: Successful validation of refresh token - Returns the refreshed access token.

401.description: Invalid or expired refresh token provided.

post.summary: Regenerates the API key for the user.
post.description: Regenerates the API key for the user. The old API key will be invalidated and a new API key will be generated.

200.description: Regeneration of API key successful - Returns the new API key.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

get.summary: Lists the TDEI datasets in the system.
get.description: This API returns filtered and sorted lists of TDEI datasets.  All text parameters x return datasets with attribute containing x, as opposed to exact match. By default results will include all datasets in released status AND all dataset in pre-release status within the requesting user's project group. This behavior can be controlled by the status parameter.  In no situation can a user see pre-release datasets from a project group the user is not part of.  Primary use cases include: name search: Given a search string X, return all datasets with a name that contains the search string X) dataset id lookup: Given a tdei_dataset_id, return the dataset with the matching id bounding box: Given xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, return datasets with dataset_area overlapping the bounding box Sorting:  Users can sort datasets by 'valid_to', 'valid_from', 'uploaded date', 'project group name', and 'status'.

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: Type of the dataset. Filters datasets by matching the exact value from the supported enumeration.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the dataset: Filters datasets by status â€” All (default) returns released datasets and pre-release datasets from the user's project groups; Pre-Release and Publish return only datasets in that status from affiliated project groups.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Dataset name or title: Filters datasets where the name or title contains the specified search text.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Dataset version: Filters datasets using an exact match on the version value.

parameters.name: data_source
parameters.description: Data source: Filters datasets by matching the exact value from the supported enumeration.

parameters.name: collection_method
parameters.description: Collection method: Filters datasets by matching the exact value from the supported enumeration.

parameters.name: collected_by
parameters.description: Collected by: Filters datasets using an exact match on the collection agency or person's name.

parameters.name: derived_from_dataset_id
parameters.description: derived_from_dataset_id: Filters datasets that are derived from the specified dataset ID. Exact match.

parameters.name: collection_date
parameters.description: collection_date: Filters datasets collected after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: confidence_level
parameters.description: Confidence level: Minimum confidence level required. Returns datasets with confidence level greater than the specified value. Range: 0 (very low) to 100 (very high).

parameters.name: schema_version
parameters.description: Schema version: Filters datasets that match the requested data type schema version. The list of supported versions can be found at /api/v1/{data_type}/versions.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: TDEI project group ID: Filters datasets that belong to the specified project group. Exact match.

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: TDEI service ID: Filters datasets that belong to the specified TDEI service. Exact match.

parameters.name: valid_from
parameters.description: Valid from: Filters datasets with a valid-from date later than the specified date-time.

parameters.name: valid_to
parameters.description: Valid to: Filters datasets with a valid-to date earlier than the specified date-time.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: TDEI dataset ID: Filters datasets by the specified TDEI dataset ID.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Bounding box: Specifies the geographic area to search within, using a bounding box defined by four coordinates in the order: west, south, east, north. Accepts an array of four numeric values.

parameters.name: other_published_locations
parameters.description: Other published locations: Lists additional places where the dataset has been published. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: dataset_update_frequency_months
parameters.description: Dataset update frequency in months: Filters datasets based on how frequently they are updated. Uses a greater than or equal to match to include datasets updated at this frequency or more often.

parameters.name: schema_validation_run_description
parameters.description: Schema validation run description: Filters datasets based on the description of the schema validation run. Accepts a string value and uses contains match.

parameters.name: full_dataset_name
parameters.description: Full dataset name: Filters datasets based on their full name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: collection_name
parameters.description: Collection name: Filters datasets based on their collection name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: department_name
parameters.description: Department name: Filters datasets based on their department name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Name of City: Filters datasets based on the city name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Region: Filters datasets based on the region name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: county
parameters.description: County: Filters datasets based on the county name. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: key_limitations
parameters.description: Key limitations: Filters datasets based on their key limitations. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: release_notes
parameters.description: Release notes: Filters datasets based on their release notes. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: challenges
parameters.description: Challenges: Filters datasets based on the challenges faced in collecting the data. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: official_maintainer
parameters.description: Official maintainer: Filters datasets based on the official maintainer. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: last_updated
parameters.description: Last updated: Filters datasets based on the last updated date. Accepts a date-time string match.

parameters.name: update_frequency
parameters.description: Update frequency: Filters datasets based on their update frequency. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: authorization_chain
parameters.description: Authorization chain: Filters datasets based on their authorization chain. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: maintenance_funded
parameters.description: Maintenance funded: Filters datasets based on whether they are funded for maintenance. Uses a boolean value.

parameters.name: funding_details
parameters.description: Funding details: Filters datasets based on their funding details. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: point_data_collection_device
parameters.description: Point data collection device: Filters datasets based on the device used for point data collection. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: node_locations_and_attributes_editing_software
parameters.description: Node locations and attributes editing software: Filters datasets based on the software used for editing node locations and attributes. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: data_collected_by_people
parameters.description: Data collected by people: Filters datasets based on whether the data was collected by people. Uses a boolean value.

parameters.name: data_collectors
parameters.description: Data collectors: Filters datasets based on the individuals or organizations that collected the data. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: data_captured_automatically
parameters.description: Data captured automatically: Filters datasets based on whether the data was captured automatically. Uses a boolean value.

parameters.name: automated_collection
parameters.description: Automated collection: Filters datasets based on whether the data was collected automatically. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: data_collectors_organization
parameters.description: Data collectors organization: Filters datasets based on the organization of the data collectors. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: data_collector_compensation
parameters.description: Data collector compensation: Filters datasets based on whether the data collectors were compensated. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: preprocessing_location
parameters.description: Preprocessing location: Filters datasets based on their preprocessing location. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: preprocessing_by
parameters.description: Preprocessing by: Filters datasets based on who performed the preprocessing. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: preprocessing_steps
parameters.description: Preprocessing steps: Filters datasets based on their preprocessing steps. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: data_collection_preprocessing_documentation
parameters.description: Data collection preprocessing documentation: Filters datasets based on the availability of data collection preprocessing documentation. Uses a boolean value.

parameters.name: documentation_uri
parameters.description: Documentation URI: Filters datasets based on their documentation URI. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: validation_process_exists
parameters.description: Validation process exists: Filters datasets based on whether a validation process exists. Uses a boolean value.

parameters.name: validation_process_description
parameters.description: Validation process description: Filters datasets based on the description of the validation process. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: validation_conducted_by
parameters.description: Validation conducted by: Filters datasets based on who conducted the validation. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: excluded_data
parameters.description: Excluded data: Filters datasets based on whether they contain excluded data. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: excluded_data_reason
parameters.description: Excluded data reason: Filters datasets based on the reason for excluding data. Supports contains match.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: page_no: Integer, defaults to 1. Filters datasets by retrieving results in pages.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size: Integer, between 1 to 50, defaults to 10.Specifies total records per page.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Sort field: The field by which to sort the results. By default, it is by uploaded timestamp. Matches the exact value from the supported enumeration.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort order: By default, it is in descending order.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of dataset entities.

400.description: Bad input request.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

put.summary: Updates the metadata of a given dataset
put.description: Updates the metadata of a dataset with the metadata in the provided file. Returns status 200 if the action is successful.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Must be a valid TDEI dataset id

200.description: Successfully updated the metadata.

400.description: The request was invalid. The metadata file provided doesn't adhere to the metadata schema.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: Given TDEI dataset ID doesnt exist.

post.summary: Clones the provided dataset to the designated project group and service.
post.description: Cloning of a dataset lets one to use the dataset being cloned as the base for a new dataset without having to upload the dataset. This operation clones the datafiles in the dataset `tdei_dataset_id` to the designated project group `tdei_project_group_id` and service `tdei_service_id`, and uses the metadata file provided along with the API as the metadata. Returns cloned dataset id if the action is successful.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Valid TDEI dataset id to be cloned.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Valid TDEI project group id.

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: Valid TDEI service id associated with the project group.

200.description: Cloning of the dataset successful. ID of the newly cloned dataset returned.

400.description: The request was invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to clone the dataset.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id, tdei_project_group_id or tdei_service_id doesn't exist in the system

get.summary: Shows the details of the jobs that the user has access to.
get.description: Returns a list of jobs including request and reponse details. By default only shows the jobs that are submitted by the user.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: Get the details for the job with id=job_id only.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: project group id of the user for which the jobs are listed for.

parameters.name: show_group_jobs
parameters.description: Make this `true` to see the jobs submitted by others also in the given project group

parameters.name: job_type
parameters.description: Use this to filter for a specific type of job

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the job. Use this to filter jobs by a specific status

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Pagination: page number to start the list from. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Total records to retrieve.Page size ranges between 1 to 50, defaults to 10.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of [JobDetails](#/components/schemas/JobDetails) entities.

400.description: The request is invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: job_id or tdei_project_group_id doesn't exist in the system

get.description: Downloads the output file generated by the job

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: job_id uniquely represents the job request

200.description: Successful response - Downloads the job output file

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: Job download file not found or Requested job not found.

delete.description: Deletes the dataset from TDEI system. This operation cannot be undone.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Valid TDEI Dataset ID

200.description: Returns true if dataset deleted successfully.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

400.description: Dataset already invalidated.

404.description: Dataset not found.

post.summary: Upload a OSW dataset.
post.description: This endpoint enables users to upload an OSW dataset. The request must include the required parameters to complete the upload. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint. By default, the dataset's status will be set to 'pre-release.' The dataset can be published using the `/publish` endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Project group id to which the dataset would be uploaded

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: TDEI service id associated with the above project group id.

parameters.name: derived_from_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id from which this dataset was derived.

dataset.description: OSW file which is expected to be a zip file, internally has {nodes, edges, points}.geojson. If the extensions are present, then the zip file will have {nodes, edges, points}.extension.geojson files

metadata.description: Metadata information for the OSW dataset. This is a JSON file that includes details on how and when the data was collected, the file's valid dates, and other relevant information about the dataset. For more details, refer to the [metadata schema](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TaskarCenterAtUW/TDEI-osw-datasvc-ts/master/schema/metadata.schema.json).

changeset.description: The changeset file records modifications to the sidewalk network included in the OSW dataset. It supports file formats with either .zip or .osc extensions.

202.description: The upload request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the uploaded request, which can be used to track the status of the upload. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the `location` header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request's input parameters are invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to upload the dataset.

404.description: derived_from_dataset_id, tdei_project_group_id or tdei_service_id doesn't exist in the system

post.summary: Publishes the OSW dataset for the tdei_dataset_id
post.description: Publishes an OSW dataset that was previously uploaded via the [POST] /osw endpoint, marking it as an official release for the mobility service. This official release status ensures visibility to all TDEI data consumers.The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be published.

202.description: The publish request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the published request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request fails to match the publish criteria.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to publish the dataset.

404.description: Dataset with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the [GET] /api/v1/osw endpoint to find valid dataset ids.

post.summary: Validates the osw dataset.
post.description: Allows a user to validate osw dataset to check the correctness of data. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

dataset.description: OSW file which is expected to be a zip file, internally has {nodes, edges, points}.geojson. If the extensions are present, then the zip file will have {nodes, edges, points}.extension.geojson files

202.description: The validate request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the validate request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Dataset input file not found.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to validate the dataset.

post.summary: OSW dataset conversion on demand
post.description: This request facilitates the conversion of an OSW dataset to OSM format, or vice versa. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

file.description: OSW dataset file which is to be converted.Supported formats are : .zip, .pbf, .osm,.xml

source_format.description: Source dataset format. Supported formats : osm, osw

target_format.description: Target dataset format. Supported formats : osm, osw

202.description: The convert request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the convert request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request failed due to an invalid file type, a missing upload file, invalid source or target formats, missing source or target inputs, or identical source and target formats.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

post.summary: Initiate confidence calculation for a dataset
post.description: Initiates the confidence calculation for requested tdei_dataset_id with optional sub-regions.Sub-regions file is a GeoJSON file containing one or more polygons.If the sub-region file is given as an input, the confidence score of each polygon inside the sub-region file will be calculated.The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset for which confidence is to be calculated.

file.description: Sub regions GeoJSON file for which confidence to be calculated

202.description: The confidence request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Missing tdei_dataset_id or dataset type is not OSW or invalid sub-region file.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Initiate Intersection Quality metric calculation for a dataset
post.description: Initiates the Intersection Quality calculation for requested `tdei_dataset_id` with optional intersection polygon file.Intersection polygon file can be a GeoJSON file containing one or more polygons.If intersection polygon file is not given the system creates vornoi polygons based on the dataset area.It is recommended to add intersection polygon file for better performance. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset for which Intersection Quality metric is to be calculated.

file.description: (Optional) GeoJSON intersection polygon file to be used to calculate intersection quality metric.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Missing tdei_dataset_id or dataset type is not OSW or Invalid intersection file.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Calculates the quality metric on a dataset element tags
post.description: Calculates the quality metric on a dataset element tags for requested tdei_dataset_id. Tags are the specific attributes or characteristics relevant to the OSW data entity. For example entities like Footway, Crossing, and Sidewalk have tags such as surface, width, incline, and length, indicating attributes like the material, size, slope, and distance. Returns the tag quality metric for the dataset element tags.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset ID for calculating the quality metrics of element tags.

file.description: OSW dataset element tag list. Example file format: [tag-quality.json](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TaskarCenterAtUW/TDEI-osw-datasvc-ts/master/schema/tag-quality.json). OSW  tag schema definition [osw-tag-definition.json](https://github.com/OpenSidewalks/OpenSidewalks-Schema/blob/Audiom/opensidewalks.schema.json#L5)

200.description: Successful response - returns the tag quality metric for the given input parameters.

400.description: Empty tag list or unknown entity type or tag.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token..

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

get.description: List of OSW data standard versions supported by TDEI. The response includes a link to the OSW data standard and specification.

200.description: List of API versions supported by TDEI.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

get.description: Downloads a specific OSW dataset as a zip file, which includes `{nodes, edges, points}.geojson` files. If file extensions are specified, the zip will contain `{nodes, edges, points}.extension.geojson` files, as well as metadata and a changeset file, if available.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be downloaded.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The system maintains two formats for the OSW dataset: OSW and OSM. By default, the OSW format is downloaded.

parameters.name: file_version
parameters.description: The Latest version includes any recent modifications.

200.description: Streams the dataset zip file.

400.description: File version requested is invalid/ tdei_dataset_id is not of type OSW.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: A file with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the /api/v1/osw endpoints to find valid file ids or Request file format not found.

post.summary: Returns a subgraph dataset that falls within a specified bounding box
post.description: When provided with a tdei_dataset_id, this request returns a subgraph dataset that falls within a specified bounding box defined by the coordinates (xmin, ymin, ymax, xmax). The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset ID to which the bounding box will be applied.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: Dataset output file type.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A bounding box defines the search area by specifying the latitude and longitude coordinates of its corners. These coordinates should be provided as a string in the order: west (longitude), south (latitude), east (longitude), north (latitude). This format outlines the geographical area to be searched within the defined perimeter.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Missing input/Dataset type is not of type OSW/Invalid bbox input.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Tags the sidewalks with the road network within proximity.
post.description: This process involves associating sidewalks from a target dataset with the road network from a source dataset based on proximity. Specifically, any part of the road network that is within a 5-meter buffer zone around the sidewalks in the target dataset gets tagged accordingly. This method ensures that sidewalks are accurately mapped in relation to nearby roads, facilitating better data integration and analysis between different geographic datasets.The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: source_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset from which the road network to be retrieved

parameters.name: target_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset for which the road network is to be tagged

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Missing input or dataset not in pre-release state.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to perform the action.

404.description: source_dataset_id/target_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Performs a spatial join operation between two datasets within the TDEI system.
post.description: Performs a spatial join operation between two datasets within the TDEI system. It involves two datasets, target and source, specifying the spatial dimension entities of each to be joined, such as edges, nodes, zones, points, lines, or polygons. The join operation is guided by specified conditions that define how the geometries of the two datasets interact, typically involving spatial functions like intersections. Additionally, filters can be applied to both datasets to refine the data involved in the join. Aggregate functions are also defined to associate the attributes from source to target dataset entity.The geometry column for data elements is specified as `geometry_target` and `geometry_source`.Eg: Find all light poles in source dataset within 5 m of an edge in target dataset, and associate the attribute highway from source dataset with each edge in target dataset. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

target_dataset_id.description: Unique dataset id defined in TDEI system

target_dimension.description: Valid opensidewalks core entity on which the join operation is to be performed

source_dataset_id.description: Unique dataset id defined in TDEI system

source_dimension.description: Valid opensidewalks core entity on which the join operation is to be performed

join_condition.description: Condition on which target and source geometry will join. geometry_target & geometry_source are constant variable representing the element geometry.

join_filter_target.description: Target attribute filters. These can be any valid attributes defined in the OpenSidewalks schema for the entity.

join_filter_source.description: Source attribute filters, These can be any valid attributes defined in the OpenSidewalks schema for the entity

aggregate.description: Agrregate function for attribute. Attribute information to be pulled along from source and attach to target dataset entity. All attribute_name/alias will be prefixed with 'ext:'

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Missing input or target dataset or source dataset type is not OSW.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to perform the action.

404.description: source_dataset_id or target_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Adds the incline tag to the dataset
post.description: Adds the **incline** tag to a specified dataset identified by the tdei_dataset_id. It takes the dataset ID as a parameter, processes the dataset to calculate the incline information, and updates the dataset with the incline tag.The original data of the dataset will be modified in this request.If the original data already has incline tag, it will be replaced. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset ID for calculating the dataset inclination.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Performs a union of the two input OSW datasets.
post.description: This function merges spatial data from two datasets by unifying overlapping nodes, edges, and polygons into consolidated geometries. It identifies equivalent nodes based on proximity, aligns and merges overlapping edges, and combines adjacent polygons. The function outputs a single cohesive dataset.The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

tdei_dataset_id_one.description: Dataset id defined to be unioned

tdei_dataset_id_two.description: Dataset id defined to be unioned

proximity.description: Proximity value to identify equivalent nodes in meters. Default value is 0.5 meters.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request body is empty.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: Dataset not found for either tdei_dataset_id_one or tdei_dataset_id_two.

post.summary: Updates the visibility preferences for the dataset viewer.
post.description: Updates the visibility preferences for a specified dataset identified by the tdei_dataset_id. It takes the dataset ID as a parameter and modifies the dataset's visibility settings.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset ID for updating the dataset viewer preferences.

allow_viewer_access.description: Indicates whether the dataset viewer access is allowed. If set to true, the dataset viewer is accessible to all users.

200.description: Visibility preferences updated successfully.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_dataset_id doesn't exist in the system.

post.summary: Accepts the feedback from the dataset viewer.
post.description: Accepts the feedback from the dataset viewer. The feedback is stored in the system for further analysis and improvement of the dataset viewer experience.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project group.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: ID of the dataset.

dataset_element_id.description: Dataset ID for which the feedback is provided.

feedback_text.description: Feedback provided by the user regarding the dataset viewer.
feedback_text.example: The dataset viewer is very informative and easy to use.

customer_email.description: Email address of the user providing feedback. This is optional and can be used for follow-up if needed.

location_latitude.description: Latitude of the location where the feedback was provided.

location_longitude.description: Longitude of the location where the feedback was provided.

200.description: Feedback accepted successfully.

400.description: Invalid input parameters.

403.description: CORS error. The request is not allowed from the current origin.

404.description: Project group or dataset not found.

get.summary: Retrieves the feedbacks from the dataset viewer.
get.description: Retrieves the feedbacks from the dataset viewer. Response includes a list of feedbacks provided by users regarding the dataset viewer. Each feedback contains details such as the dataset element ID, feedback text, customer email, and location information.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: ID of the project group.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: ID of the dataset.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: from_date: Date in ISO 8601 format, filters feedbacks created after this date.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: to_date: Date in ISO 8601 format, filters feedbacks created before this date.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: sort_by: String, defaults to 'created_at'. Sorts feedbacks by the specified field.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: sort_order: String, defaults to 'desc'. Sorts feedbacks in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: page_no: Integer, defaults to 1. Filters feedbacks by retrieving results in pages.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size: Integer, between 1 to 50, defaults to 10.Specifies total records per page.

200.description: Feedbacks retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the feedbacks metadata. Response includes a summary of feedbacks such as total count, total overdue, and other relevant statistics.

200.description: Feedbacks retrieved successfully.

post.summary: Upload a GTFS Flex dataset.
post.description: This endpoint enables users to upload a GTFS-Flex dataset. The request must include the required parameters to complete the upload. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint. By default, the dataset's status will be set to 'pre-release.' The dataset can be published using the /publish endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Project group id to which the dataset would be uploaded

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: TDEI service id associated with the above project group id.

parameters.name: derived_from_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id from which this dataset was derived.

dataset.description: GTFS Flex file which is expected to be a zip file. It typically includes .txt files that define details such as service areas and stops for flexible transit routes.

metadata.description: Metadata information for the GTFS-Flex dataset. This is a JSON file that includes details on how and when the data was collected, the file's valid dates, and other relevant information about the dataset. For more details, refer to the [metadata schema](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TaskarCenterAtUW/TDEI-osw-datasvc-ts/master/schema/metadata.schema.json).

changeset.description: The changeset file records modifications to the sidewalk network included in the GTFS-Flex dataset. It supports file formats with either .zip or .osc extensions.

202.description: The upload request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the uploaded request, which can be used to track the status of the upload. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the `location` header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request's input parameters are invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to upload the dataset.

404.description: derived_from_dataset_id, tdei_project_group_id or tdei_service_id doesn't exist in the system

post.summary: Publishes the GTFS Flex dataset for the tdei_dataset_id
post.description: Publishes a GTFS Flex dataset that was previously uploaded via the [POST] /gtfs-flex endpoint, marking it as an official release for the mobility service. This official release status ensures visibility to all TDEI data consumers. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be published

202.description: The publish request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the published request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request fails to match the publish criteria.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to publish the dataset.

404.description: Dataset with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the [GET] /api/v1/gtfs-flex endpoint to find valid dataset ids.

post.summary: Validates the GTFS Flex dataset.
post.description: Allows a user to validate GTFS Flex dataset to check the correctness of data. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

dataset.description: GTFS Flex file which is expected to be a zip file. It typically includes .txt files that define details such as service areas and stops for flexible transit routes.

202.description: The validate request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the validate request, which can be used to track the status of the validate request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Dataset input file not found.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to validate the dataset.

get.description: Downloads a specific GTFS Flex dataset as zip containing .txt files that define details such as service areas and stops for flexible transit routes.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be downloaded.

200.description: Streams the dataset zip file.

400.description: tdei_dataset_id is not of type GTFS-Flex.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: A file with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the /api/v1/gtfs-flex endpoints to find valid file ids.

get.description: List of GTFS Flex data standard versions supported by TDEI. The response includes a link to the GTFS Flex data standard and specification.

200.description: Returns list of GTFS Flex versions supported by TDEI.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

post.summary: upload a pre-release of GTFS Pathways dataset.
post.description: This endpoint enables users to upload a GTFS-Pathways dataset. The request must include the required parameters to complete the upload. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint. By default, the dataset's status will be set to 'pre-release.' The dataset can be published using the /publish endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Project group id to which the dataset would be uploaded

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: TDEI service id associated with the above project group id.

parameters.name: derived_from_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id from which this dataset was derived.

dataset.description: GTFS Pathways file which is expected to be a zip file, internally has .txt files that represent transit details.

metadata.description: Metadata information for the GTFS-Pathways dataset. This is a JSON file that includes details on how and when the data was collected, the file's valid dates, and other relevant information about the dataset. For more details, refer to the [metadata schema](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TaskarCenterAtUW/TDEI-osw-datasvc-ts/master/schema/metadata.schema.json).

changeset.description: The changeset file records modifications to the sidewalk network included in the GTFS-Pathways dataset. It supports file formats with either .zip or .osc extensions.

202.description: The upload request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the uploaded request, which can be used to track the status of the upload. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the `location` header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request's input parameters are invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to upload the dataset.

404.description: derived_from_dataset_id, tdei_project_group_id or tdei_service_id doesn't exist in the system

post.summary: Publishes the GTFS Pathways dataset for the tdei_dataset_id
post.description: Publishes an GTFS Pathways dataset that was previously uploaded via the [POST] /gtfs-pathways endpoint, marking it as an official release for the mobility service. This official release status ensures visibility to all TDEI data consumers. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be published.

202.description: The publish request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the published request, which can be used to track the status of the request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: The request fails to match the publish criteria.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to publish the dataset.

404.description: Dataset with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the [GET] /api/v1/gtfs-pathways endpoint to find valid dataset ids.

post.summary: Validates the GTFS Pathways dataset.
post.description: Allows a user to validate GTFS Pathways dataset to check the correctness of data. The response includes a `job_id` for tracking the request.To check the request status, refer to the location header in the response, which provides the URL for the status API endpoint.

dataset.description: GTFS Pathways file which is expected to be a zip file, internally has .txt files that represent transit details.

202.description: The validate request has been accepted for processing. It returns a `job_id`, a unique identifier for the validate request, which can be used to track the status of the validate request. The endpoint to check the status is provided in the location header of the response.

Location.description: Location api to find the status of request processing

400.description: Dataset input file not found.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

403.description: User unauthorized to validate the dataset.

get.description: Download a specific GTFS Pathways dataset as zip containing .txt files that represent transit details.

parameters.name: tdei_dataset_id
parameters.description: Dataset id of the dataset to be downloaded.

200.description: Streams the dataset zip file.

400.description: tdei_dataset_id is not of type GTFS Pathways.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: A file with the specified tdei_dataset_id was not found. Use the /api/v1/gtfs-pathways endpoints to find valid file ids.

get.description: List of GTFS Pathways data standard versions supported by TDEI. The response includes a link to the GTFS Pathways data standard and specification.

200.description: Returns list of GTFS Pathways versions supported by TDEI.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

get.description: Retrieves the list of services in the TDEI system. By default lists all the services in the TDEI system

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: Get the details for the service with id=job_id only.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: Search by service name.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Gets the services belonging to a specific project group.`tdei_project_group_id` can be retrieved using the api `api/v1/project-groups`

parameters.name: service_type
parameters.description: Type of the service. Default list displays services with all types

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Pagination: page number to start the list from.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Total records to retrieve.Page size ranges between 1 to 50, defaults to 10.

200.description: Successful response - Returns the list of services.

400.description: Service type invalid.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_service_id or tdei_project_group_id doesn't exist in the system.

get.description: Retrieves the list of project groups in the TDEI system. By default lists all the prohect groups in the TDEI system.

parameters.name: tdei_project_group_id
parameters.description: Get the details of the project group with id=tdei_project_group_id only.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: Search by project group name.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Pagination: page number to start the list from.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Total records to retrieve.Page size ranges between 1 to 50, defaults to 10.

200.description: Successful response - returns the list of Project Groups.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: tdei_project_group_id doesn't exist in the system.

get.description: Returns a list of supported versions of the TDEI API.

200.description: Returns a list of supported api versions.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

get.description: Retrieves metrics related to the system and datasets within the TDEI platform. This endpoint provides an overview of usage statistics including the total number of users, services, and project groups, as well as a breakdown of services by type. Additionally, it gives details on dataset uploads, such as the total number of uploads and their cumulative size in megabytes.

200.description: Successful response - Returns the system metrics.

401.description: Unauthenticated request

get.description: This endpoint provides detailed metrics about datasets categorized by type within the TDEI platform. It includes the total number of datasets and their cumulative size in megabytes for each type, such as osw, flex, and pathways. For the osw type, additional aggregated statistics like the number of crossings, length of sidewalks in kilometers, number of edges and nodes, and the area covered by the concave hull in square kilometers are also provided.

200.description: Successful response - Returns the data metrics.

401.description: Unauthenticated request

post.summary: Request for password recovery
post.description: This request initiates a password recovery process for the specified email address. Upon submission, the system sends an email containing a link that the user can follow to reset their password. This allows users to securely update their password if they have forgotten it or wish to change it for security reasons.

200.description: Request for password recovery was successful. An email with a link to reset the password has been sent.

400.description: Request failed due to an invalid or missing email address.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: User not found.

post.summary: Request for email verification link
post.description: This request sends an email verification link to the specified email address. The email verification link is initially sent following successful registration. If the user does not receive the initial verification email, they can request to have the verification link resent.

200.description: Request for email verification was successful. An email verification link has been sent.

400.description: Request failed due to an invalid or missing email address.

401.description: Unauthenticated request. Check your access token.

404.description: User not found.

username.description: email that was used during registration

name.description: Dataset Title that this data is known by

description.description: Free text description of the data

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected.

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected.

challenges.description: Challenges faced in collecting the data

last_updated.description: Date when the dataset was last updated

node_locations_and_attributes_editing_so.description: Node locations and attributes editing software

data_collection_preprocessing_documentat.description: Is data collection preprocessing documentation available

derived_from_dataset_id.description: Dataset id from which this dataset was derived

project_group.description: tdei-assigned project group id. Represented as UUID. Project Group ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1/project-group path.

service.description: Service id. Represented as UUID. Project Group ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1/services path.

confidence_level.description: tdei-generated confidence level. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

tdei_dataset_id.description: unique id identifying the file in the tdei system, can be used to retrieve the file itself.

download_url.description: The url from which this file can be downloaded.

versions.description: A list of the versions of a data standard (GTFS-Flex, GTFS-Pathways, OSW) supported by TDEI.

documentation.description: Link to the data standard documentation.

VersionSpec.description: Response model for data standard versions

versions.description: List of API versions supported by TDEI.

tdei_project_group_id.description: ProjectGroupId uniquely represented in the TDEI system. System generated.

phone.description: Phone of the project group for communication.

url.description: Url of the transit project group.

address.description: Address of the transit project group.

dataset_viewer_allowed.description: Flag to indicate to allow all datasets within the project group to be viewed on the dataset viewer.

feedback_turnaround_time.description: Feedback turnaround time for the project group.

number.description: Number of days for feedback turnaround time.

unit.description: Unit of time for feedback turnaround time.

tdei_service_id.description: Unique id that represents the service

download_url.description: download_url for requested job. This will be available only if the job is completed and job_type required download_url

message.description: Response message from the job process. In case of an error, shows the error messages here.

tdei_project_group_id.description: tdei project group id under which the job was requested

tdei_project_group_name.description: tdei project group nunder which the job was requested

request_input.description: Inputs that were provided whlie requesting this job

response_props.description: Dynamic response object type that depends on the job_type

updated_at.description: date-time that job was last updated

data_type.description: data type of the job request

current_stage.description: current processing stage of the job request

total_stages.description: total number of stages in the job

current_stage.description: description of the current processing stage of the job

completed_stages.description: number of stages completed in the job

current_state.description: status of the job in current state

current_stage_percent_done.description: percentage of the current stage completed

last_updated_at.description: date-time when the job was last updated

algorithms.description: List of algorithms to calculate the quality metric against. Currently supports fixed and random

total_entity_count.description: Total number of entities in the dataset

overall_quality_metric.description: Overall quality metric for the dataset in percentage

additionalProperties.title: tag
additionalProperties.description: Quality metric for the tag in percentage

feedback_text.description: Feedback text provided by the user.

dataset_element_id.description: ID of the specific dataset element related to the feedback.

location_latitude.description: Latitude of the location related to the feedback.

location_longitude.description: Longitude of the location related to the feedback.

due_date.description: Due date for the feedback response.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the feedback was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the feedback was last updated.

FeedbackMetadata.description: Additional metadata related to the feedback.

AuthorizationToken.description: Authorization Token required by all applications that use the TDEI Consumer API to perform authorized actions.

ApiKey.description: Api Key required by all applications that use the TDEI Consumer API.
ApiKey.name: x-api-key
